name: 肌力與體能運動處方設計
restrict: ◎必須先修過【PEU0193  人體解剖生理學】、【PEU0015  運動生理學】 ◎課程開放上修
goals: Critically analyze the energy and strength requirements for athletic events.
Demonstrate and critic proper weight lifting technique.
Demonstrate their ability to apply exercise prescription for aerobic and anaerobic Athletic Teams.
Demonstrate their knowledge of administration and organization of a strength training facility.
syllabus:
Week 1: Introduction and Syllabus (Feb 14th)

Week 2: Ch. 12 & 13 Administration, Scoring and Interpretation of Selected Tests(Feb 21st)

Week 4: _Testing Day 1 / Dynamic Warm-up / Pre-Test Combine_ (March 7th)

              Ch. 14 Warm-Up and Flexibility Training

              _Dynamic WU / Conclude assessments / Static stretch routine_

Week 5: Ch. 3 Bioenergetics of Exercise and Training (March 14th ) 

              Ch. 2 The Biomechanics of Resistance Exercise

              Ch. 4 Endocrine Responses to Resistance Exercise

Week 6: Ch. 15 Exer. Technique - Free Weight and Machine Training (March 21st)

            _Hands on Day (Weight Room) Resistance Training Exercise Critique_

Week 7: Ch. 16 Exercise Techniques for Alternative Modes & Non-Traditional Training

              Ch. 17 Program Design for Resistance Training (March 28th)

                         Weight Room Day (Lifting Technique Presentations) #1

Week 9: Ch. 18 Prog. Design and Technique for Plyometric Training (April 11th)

              Ch. 19 Program Design and Technique for Speed and Agility Training

                         _Hands on Day (Track and Field) Plyometric and Sprint Critique_

Week 10: Ch. 5 Adaptations to Anaerobic Training Programs (April 18th )

                Ch. 20 Program Design and Technique for Aerobic Endurance Training

                Ch. 6 Adaptations to Aerobic Endurance Training Programs

Week 11: Ch. 21 Periodization (April 25th)

                Ch. 22 Rehabilitation and Reconditioning

                           Weight Room Day (Lifting Technique Presentations) #2

Week 12: Ch. 7 Age and Sex Related Differences (May 2nd)

                Ch. 1 Structure and Function of Body Systems

Week 13: Ch. 9 Basic Nutrition Factors in Health (May 9th)                                

                Ch. 10 Nutrition Strategies for Maximizing Performance 

                Ch. 11 Performance – Enhancing Substances and Methods

Week 14: Ch. 8 Psychology of Athletic Prep. and Performance (May 16th)

                         Weight Room Day (Lifting Technique Presentations) #3

Week 15: Ch. 23 Facility Design, Layout and Organization (May 23nd)

                Ch. 24 Facility Policies, Procedures and Legal Issues

Week 16: Review for Final (May 30th)

                Weight Room Day #4

Finals Week: Final Examination (June 6th )

**Assignments:**

Participation in lecture and class projects is expected. 

\*\*Schedule is subject to change to ensure all course objectives are met. Additional assignments will be announced throughout the semester\*\*

**Students will be required to develop a comprehensive training program for the sport of their choice.  The training program will cover a one year period, pre-season, in-season and off-season.  The principles of overtraining and periodization must be incorporated.**

**Students will teach a 1) lift technique; 2) Stretch/warm-up**
prerequisite: Prerequisite course: 【PEU0193  Human Anatomy and Physiology】、【PEU0015  Sport Physiology】 ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
